headline: Molson Coors Beverage (TAP) Is Down 6.3% After Impairment-Driven Loss And Dividend Hike - Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In February 2026, Molson Coors Beverage Company reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing lower sales of US$3,125.8 million and reduced net income of US$238.3 million versus the prior year, alongside a full-year net loss of US$2.14 billion driven by a large non-cash goodwill impairment. Despite the weaker performance and impairment-driven loss, the company raised its quarterly dividend to US$0.48 per share and pushed further into higher-margin flavored alcohol with new Topo Chico Hard...
